head.supplied: Botanic Gardens ¶ 30 July 1867 ¶ Sir ¶ ¶ By Dr Mueller's desire, who I regret to state was obliged to go for a short period to Queenscliff as his failing health made it imperative to him to seek rest...

div.p: No. 3476, unit 733, VPRS 3181/P Town Clerk's files series 1, VA 511 Melbourne, Public Record Office, Victoria.

To proof.
Letter written by M’s assistant Ernst Heyne on M’s behalf. Botanic Gardens

By Dr Mueller's desire, who I regret to state was obliged to go for a short period to Queenscliff as his failing health made it imperative to him to seek restoration of it by change of air and a little relaxation from his onerous labours, I have the honor of acknowledging the receipt of your letter of the 24 inst. in which you inform him that the City Council has kindly consented to enclose a piece of land lyeing between the Immigrants Home and the Yarra on the Eastern side of the approach to Prince's Bridge. I am also instructed to return to the Council and to you Dr Muellers thanks for having kindly acceded to his suggestion as this will enable him to carry out some improvements in this conspicous locality.
